name: Ashok Bharathi Senguttuvan
top_product: Corporate offices FMCG or product-based companies Retail chains and restaurants (for menu cards, boxes, danglers, tent cards) Educational institutions and publishers (for textbooks, magazines, booklets) Event management agencies (for invitations, posters, stickers, tags) Political or social organizations (for leaflets, brochures, banners)
ideal_referral: 1. Corporate Clients Examples: Large companies, IT firms, manufacturing businesses. Why?: They need regular printing for brochures, marketing materials, internal documents, packaging inserts, etc. Ideal Contact: Marketing Manager, Procurement Head. 2. Educational Institutions Examples: Universities, schools, coaching centers. Why?: Frequent printing of textbooks, exam papers, brochures, certificates. Ideal Contact: Principal, Admin Officer. 3. Event Management Companies Why?: They regularly require banners, posters, invites, standees, and branded materials for events and expos. Ideal Contact: Event Coordinator, Creative Head. 4. Advertising / Marketing Agencies Why?: They design and outsource printing for their clients’ campaigns — from flyers to premium packaging. Ideal Contact: Creative Director, Production Head. 5. Political Campaign Teams Why?: High-volume printing during elections for banners, handouts, posters, etc. Ideal Contact: Campaign Manager, Local Party Head. 6. Exporters / Product Manufacturers Why?: They often need packaging, labels, product manuals, and branded promotional materials. Ideal Contact: Export Manager, Production Head. 7. Franchise Chains or Retail Stores Examples: Restaurant chains, clothing brands. Why?: Consistent need for menus, point-of-sale materials, signage. Ideal Contact: Franchise Owner, Marketing Manager.
top_problem_solved: Many of my business problems have been solved through BNI. Running a printing business comes with its own set of challenges — from finding reliable vendors, trustworthy clients, skilled designers, and last-minute support, to breaking into new markets or industries. Before BNI, I faced many of these issues alone. But through BNI's structured system of referrals, trust, and collaboration, I found exactly what I needed: Trusted contacts who referred me to genuine clients. Solutions from fellow members who understood my challenges. Strategic partners who helped grow my capabilities. Fellow business owners who were just as invested in my success as I was in theirs. The referral-based model of BNI is not just about leads. It’s about solving problems, sharing knowledge, and creating a circle of support that every entrepreneur needs but rarely finds. BNI didn’t just give me business. It gave me confidence, clarity, and a community. If you’re a business owner facing roadblocks — big or small — I can assure you: the right connections can change everything. And for me, those connections came through BNI.
